item.description:
Wadsworth Falls Walk, Middletown

When: Sunday May 10, 1:30 PM

Come take an east walk around a state park. There are lots of trails and waterfalls to see. This park was gives to the state by Colonel Clarence Wadsworth. He spent his life preserving this natural area for future generations.

This will be an easy walk of about 3 miles on moderate ups and downs. Social walking pace. We will be out for 2 to 3 hours. Rain cancels.

Dogs and children are welcome as long as they are calm and well behaved.

Location: 721 Wadsworth St, Middletown. We will gather in the parking lot.
http://www.mapquest.c...

Walk is being lead by Larry. Contact him through his profile: http://www.meetup.com...
